   probably has component of infection.  Patient is a chronic aspirator
   per report and could have aspiration pneumonia.  Intubated in the
   emergency room.  Is tolerating the vent well on AC 50%, Vt 500, and

   - wean of levofed as tolerated for MAP >60
   - follow lactates
   .

   coming from an institution.
   - vanco/zosyn for broad coverage
   - sputum, blood cultures
   - consider flagyl if decompensating for aspiration
   - Will place PICC for likely prolonged antibiotic course and limited IV
   access
   .
   # NSTEMI: troponin leak, likely demand ischemia, had EKG changes with
   ST depression in precordial leads.
   - asa 325 mg daily, no heparin necessary
   - high dose statin
   - holding BB and ACEI in setting of hypotension
   - trend CEs
   - echo in AM
   .

   failure.  Hypotension resolved with 3 L NS and PRBCs.
   - hold on diuresis given hypotension
   - levofed as needed for now
   - echo in AM
   .

   - restart coumadin tomorrow if hct stable
   .
   # Anemia: has hct of 21 from baseline of high 20s to 30.  Unclear
   etiology of bleed. Has had transient lows like this in the past.
   - s/p 2 units of PRBCs
   - trend hcts q12hrs
   - guiac all stools
   .
   # DM: stable
   - ISS
   .
